page.title: 13LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: { LIBRARY REPORT The library,built in 1963 on the site of the White Hart gardens,had 7572 members in 1984,including 2303 children. Under 5's enjoy 'Easy-read' books. 10-12-year-olds enjoy books about space, and use project books for schoolwork. Non-fiction subjects include gardening, sport, cookery, travel, biographies, pets and natural history. { } { LEISURE Swimming is available at Stowe and at the London Road pool in Buckingham; football is played at Stratford Fields and tennis at Chackmore. The River Ouse and Hyde Lane Lake provide fishing facilities,and local village halls hold W.I. meetings.
